p:
The substitution rate and the time of most recent common ancestor (tMRCA) were estimated for each lineage/sublineage using the Bayesian Markov Chain Monte Carlo (MCMC) method available in the BEAST package [32]. Prior to the MCMC analysis, the linear regression and residual analyses for each lineage were performed using Path-O-Gen [63]; significant outliers identified were then removed. To reduce excessive computational load, we followed the common strategy that achieves computer tractability while preserving the accuracy of the estimates [64]. We wrote a Java program to select around 120 sequences from each lineage or sublineage, which represent viruses sampled from different locations and at different time points. In all cases, the data were analyzed under the GTR (General Time Reversible) +
nucleotide substitution model, as this model was consistently found to be the best by Modeltest [65].
